metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3955 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The usbip_recv_xbuff function in drivers/usb/usbip/usbip_common.c in the Linux kernel before 4.5.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds write) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted length value in a USB/IP packet. It was discovered that an out-of-bounds write could occur when handling incoming packets in the USB/IP implementation in the Linux kernel. A remote attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3955` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-22-generic - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-lowlatency - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-4.4.0-22-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-22.39
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-22-generic - 4.4.0-22.39
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> driver moved from staging in 3.17

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-22.39').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'abandoned').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1010.12').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-22.39').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1013.14').
